resources.string:
✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Requires high rainfall (120-250 cm) and humid conditions

 ✅ Soil: Best grown in alluvial and clayey soil

 ✅ Usage: Staple food in Odisha, used for rice-based dishes like Pakhala Bhata

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Grown in coastal and delta regions like Cuttack and Puri

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Field puddling, apply 10-15 tons/ha FYM

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July & Nov-Dec): Transplanting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 30-40 kg/ha

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Jan): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Continuous flooding; Butachlor (1.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, Bacterial leaf blight – Mancozeb (2g/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct & March-April): 120-150 days. Yield: 3-5 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Requires 50-100 cm rainfall with warm temperatures

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained sandy loam soil

 ✅ Usage: Used in food, fodder, and industrial products

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in western Odisha (Koraput, Kalahandi)

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July & Oct-Nov): Drilling method (60 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 20-25 kg/ha

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 120 kg N, 60 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): 2-3 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fall armyworm, rust – Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct & Feb-March): 90-120 days. Yield: 3-4 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 ✅ Climate: Grows well in areas with 100-120 cm rainfall

 ✅ Soil: Prefers red and lateritic soil

 ✅ Usage: Used for porridge, roti, and baby food

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Common in tribal areas like Kandhamal and Rayagada

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 8-10 kg/ha

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Aug): 40 kg N, 30 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Sept): 2 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, smut – Mancozeb (2g/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 110-130 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Requires 50-75 cm rainfall and warm weather

 ✅ Soil: Best in sandy loam soil with good drainage

 ✅ Usage: Used for dal, sprouts, and sweets

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Widely grown in coastal districts like Balasore and Bhadrak

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2️⃣ Sowing (July & Nov): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Yellow mosaic virus – Neem oil spray or Imidacloprid (0.5 ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept & Feb-March): 80-100 days. Yield: 1-1.5 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Requires 60-80 cm rainfall and moderate temperatures

 ✅ Soil: Grows in loamy or lateritic soil

 ✅ Usage: Used in dal, snacks, and idli batter

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in interior districts like Nuapada and Malkangiri

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2️⃣ Sowing (July & Nov): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at pod formation. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew – Sulfur spray (2g/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept & Feb-March): 90-110 days. Yield: 1-2 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 ✅ Climate: Needs warm, humid climate with 50-75 cm rainfall

 ✅ Soil: Thrives in sandy loam soil with good drainage

 ✅ Usage: Used in oil extraction, sweets, and Ayurvedic medicine

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in districts like Ganjam and Kendrapara

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2️⃣ Sowing (July-Aug): Broadcasting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 3-5 kg/ha

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 20 kg N, 30 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Oct): Rain-fed crop, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Leaf spot – Copper oxychloride (2g/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 80-100 days. Yield: 0.8-1.5 tons/ha

✅ Season: Summer (April-July)

 ✅ Climate: Requires tropical & subtropical climate, rainfall 75-250 cm

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained loamy soil

 ✅ Usage: Fresh consumption, juices, pickles

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Grown in Ganjam, Dhenkanal, Angul

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (July-August): 8x8m spacing, grafted saplings used

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K per tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, mulching with dry leaves

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Mango hoppers – Neem-based insecticide spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (April-July): 3-5 years after planting, yield 12-15 tons/ha

✅ Season: Winter & Summer

 ✅ Climate: Requires tropical climate, rainfall 100-150 cm

 ✅ Soil: Best in sandy loam or lateritic soil

 ✅ Usage: Consumed fresh, in jams, juices

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Cuttack, Bhadrak, Mayurbhanj

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (April-May): 10-12 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (June-July): 5x5m spacing, deep pits for seedlings

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 400g N, 250g P, 500g K per tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit fly – Malathion spray (2ml/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct-April): 2-3 years after planting, yield 15-20 tons/ha

✅ Season: Year-round

 ✅ Climate: Hot & humid climate, rainfall 150-200 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, rich in organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, banana chips, fiber production

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Balasore, Koraput, Puri

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Jan-Feb): 20-25 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (March-April): 1.5x1.5m spacing, suckers transplanted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 400g K per tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with banana leaves

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Panama wilt – Copper fungicide spray (3g/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (10-12 months after planting): Yield 30-35 tons/ha

✅ Season: Summer (March-June)

 ✅ Climate: Tropical & humid, rainfall 150-200 cm

 ✅ Soil: Lateritic, well-drained soil

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, processed into chips, sweets

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Found in Rayagada, Kandhamal, Keonjhar

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (March-April): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (May-June): 8x8m spacing, saplings transplanted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (June-Nov): 500g N, 300g P, 400g K per tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with organic matter

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer – Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (March-June): 4-5 years after planting, yield 20-25 tons/ha
Coconut (East Coast Tall, Odisha Tall, Chandrakalpa)
🥥 Coconut \n (East Coast Tall, Odisha Tall, Chandrakalpa)

✅ Season: Year-round

 ✅ Climate: Tropical & humid, rainfall 150-300 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy soil with good moisture retention

 ✅ Usage: Oil extraction, fresh consumption, coir industry

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Khurda, Puri, Ganjam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (April-May): 10-12 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (June-July): 7.5x7.5m spacing, seedlings planted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K per tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with coconut husk

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Rhinoceros beetle – Neem cake application

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Year-round): 5-6 years after planting, yield 80-100 nuts/tree

✅ Season: Rainy & Winter (July-December)

 ✅ Climate: Humid subtropical, rainfall 150-250 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with acidic pH

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, processed products

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Grown in Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar, Sundargarh

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (March-April): 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (May-June): 30x60 cm spacing, suckers planted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (June-Dec): 200g N, 150g P, 250g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, weeding every 45 days

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Mealybugs – Insecticide spray (Chlorpyrifos 2ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (July-Dec): 2 years after planting, yield 30-35 tons/ha
Brinjal (Utkal Anushree, Utkal Keshari, Swarna Mani)
🍆 Brinjal \n (Utkal Anushree, Utkal Keshari, Swarna Mani)

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-30°C), moderate rainfall 80-120 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used for curries, fries, and pickles

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Grown in Cuttack, Balasore, Ganjam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June & Oct): Plowed 2-3 times, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Nursery Raising (June-July, Oct-Nov): Seeds sown in raised beds, transplanted after 25-30 days

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 50 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Light irrigation at 7-10 days interval

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Shoot borer – Neem oil spray, Carbaryl dust for aphids

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Feb): 70-80 days after transplanting, yield 25-30 tons/ha
Tomato (Arka Rakshak, Utkal Kumari, Swarna Lalima)
🍅 Tomato \n (Arka Rakshak, Utkal Kumari, Swarna Lalima)

✅ Season: Rabi (Winter)

 ✅ Climate: Moderate temperature (20-25°C), low humidity

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loam, rich in organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, sauces, and salads

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Kandhamal, Bargarh, Sambalpur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plowing with FYM 20 tons/ha

 2️⃣ Nursery Raising (Nov-Dec): Seedlings raised in trays, transplanted at 25 days

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 100 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-April): Drip irrigation preferred

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Early blight – Mancozeb spray (2.5g/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (March-May): 90-100 days after transplanting, yield 30-35 tons/ha

✅ Season: Rabi (Winter)

 ✅ Climate: Cool climate (15-20°C), moderate rainfall 80-100 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, fries, and pickles

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Koraput, Rayagada, Nayagarh

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Aug-Sept): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Nursery Raising (Sept-Oct): Seeds sown in trays, transplanted at 30-35 days

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Oct-Dec): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 100 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Nov-Feb): Irrigated every 7-10 days, earthing up done

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Downy mildew – Copper oxychloride spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Jan-March): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm climate (22-30°C), moderate rainfall 80-120 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used as a spice and in pickles

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Balangir, Kalahandi, Malkangiri

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June, Oct-Nov): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Nursery Raising (June & Nov): Seeds sown in raised beds, transplanted at 30-35 days

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Irrigation every 7-10 days, mulching applied

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Thrips – Neem oil spray, fungal issues managed with Mancozeb spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Feb): 120-150 days after transplanting, yield 15-20 tons/ha
Okra (Utkal Gaurav, Arka Anamika, Pusa Bhindi-5)
🌱 Okra \n (Utkal Gaurav, Arka Anamika, Pusa Bhindi-5)

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm and humid (25-35°C), moderate rainfall 80-120 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, fries, and sambar

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Angul, Khordha, Keonjhar

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Feb-April, June-Aug): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Sowing (March-May, July-Sept): Direct seeding at 45x30 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Irrigation every 4-5 days in summer

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Whitefly – Neem oil spray, Yellow vein mosaic virus managed with resistant varieties

 6️⃣ Harvesting (June-Nov): 45-55 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
Onion (NHRDF Red-2, Bhima Shakti, Agrifound Light Red)
🧅 Onion \n (NHRDF Red-2, Bhima Shakti, Agrifound Light Red)

✅ Season: Rabi & Kharif

 ✅ Climate: Cool season (15-25°C), moderate rainfall 80-100 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and raw salads

 ✅ Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Sambalpur, Boudh, Sundargarh

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plowed & beds prepared, FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Nursery Raising (Nov-Dec): Seedlings raised in trays, transplanted at 45 days

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-April): Irrigation every 5-7 days, mulching applied

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Thrips – Neem oil spray, Purple blotch controlled with Mancozeb spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (March-May): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 25-30 tons/ha
4)Bhoomihina Agriculturist Loan and Resources Augmentation Model
🌱 Bhoomihina Agriculturist Loan and Resources Augmentation Model (BALARAM)
BALARAM is a scheme by the Odisha government to provide loans to landless farmers and sharecroppers for agricultural activities.
- Landless farmers, sharecroppers, or oral lessees.\n - Resident of Odisha.\n - Member of a Joint Liability Group (JLG) of 5 members.
- Loan up to ₹1.6 lakh per JLG.\n - No collateral required.\n - Loans for crop production, equipment, and farm activities.
Applications open year-round. Apply during any cropping season.
Visit Krishi Bhavan or contact Block Agricultural Officer (BAO). Register JLG and apply through partner banks.
Supports farmers with subsidies for buying modern farm equipment.
All farmers of Odisha, including FPOs and Cooperatives.
Subsidies for tractors, power tillers, harvesters, and tools.
Applications open before cropping seasons as notified.
Apply online on the Agriculture Department portal or visit Krishi Bhavan.
